title: George G. Vega Yon
text:
I am an Assistant Professor of Research at the Division of Epidemiology at the University of Utah. I work on studying Complex Systems using Statistical Computing. I have over ten years of experience developing scientific software focusing on high-performance computing, data visualization, and social network analysis. My training is in Public Policy (M.A. UAI, 2011), Economics (M.Sc. Caltech, 2015), and Biostatistics (Ph.D. USC, 2020).
I obtained my Ph.D. in Biostatistics under the supervision of Prof. Paul Marjoram and Prof. Kayla de la Haye, with my dissertation titled “Essays on Bioinformatics and Social Network Analysis: Statistical and Computational Methods for Complex Systems.”
I’m available for coding, data science, network science, and data visualization consulting.

title: Software
text:
Here are some of the key software packages I have developed:

netplot: Beautiful network plots using ggplot2
ergmito: ERGMs for small networks
slurmR: R and SLURM integration
ABCoptim: Artificial Bee Colony optimization
netdiffuseR: Network diffusion analysis
epiworldR: Agent-based modeling for epidemiology
rgexf: R package for GEXF graph files

For a complete and up-to-date list, please visit my GitHub profile or the software.bib file in my resume repository.

title: Software
text:
Development Philosophy
I believe in developing software that is:

Open Source: All my packages are freely available under permissive licenses
Well Documented: Comprehensive documentation with examples and tutorials

Tested: Rigorous testing to ensure reliability
Performant: Optimized for speed, especially for large-scale computations
User-Friendly: Intuitive APIs that follow R conventions

title: Software
text:
Contributions
I actively contribute to the R ecosystem and have contributed to various open-source projects. My packages are available on:

CRAN (The Comprehensive R Archive Network)
GitHub (Development versions and additional tools)

text:
Support and Issues
If you encounter issues with any of my software or have feature requests, please:

Search existing issues on the GitHub repository
Open a new issue with a reproducible example
For general questions, feel free to email me

Network epidemiology: Developing models for disease spread in networks
Social network analysis: Creating tools for analyzing social structures
High-performance computing: Optimizing statistical algorithms for parallel computing

title: George G. Vega Yon - Quarto Website
text:
This is the source code for my personal website built with Quarto.



index.qmd - Homepage with bio and social links
talks.qmd - Automatically fetches talks from gvegayon/talks repository
publications.qmd - Links to Google Scholar profile and research overview
software.qmd - Automatically fetches software list from gvegayon/resume
_quarto.yml - Main configuration file
styles.css / custom.scss - Custom styling




The website is configured to automatically update weekly via GitHub Actions, fetching the latest: - Talks from the talks repository - Software from the resume repository
- Publications metadata



To build the website locally:

Install Quarto
Install required R packages: httr, rvest, stringr, rmarkdown, knitr
Run quarto render




The website is automatically built and deployed using GitHub Actions with the rocker/tidyverse:4.5.1 container, which includes Quarto and all necessary R packages.



The original HTML website is preserved in the public directory and serves as the baseline for the new Quarto version.
